Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Proof.
unfold R_sc in sc_R_1; unfold R_sc in sc_R_2.
unfold R_sc in R_sc; simpl in *.
rewrite g_app_inv in R_sc; destruct R_sc as [L R].
unfold g_app in R; rewrite g_app_inv in R; destruct R as [L' R'].
rewrite <- g_app in R; simpl in *.
apply g_subcode in R; destruct R as [rho R].
simpl in *.
apply subcode_g in R; destruct R as [rho' R].
rewrite <- R_sc; simpl in *.
unfold sc_R_1 in sc_R_1; unfold sc_R_2 in sc_R_2.
apply sc_R_1 in R; apply sc_R_2 in R.
rewrite <- R_sc; simpl in *.
Qed.
